thread.title: Watch: Mark Helfrich on 'frustrating' loss to Washington State
thread.title_full: Watch: Mark Helfrich on 'frustrating' loss to Washington State | OregonLive.com

author: Molly Blue | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Watch: Mark Helfrich on 'frustrating' loss to Washington State
text:
EUGENE -- The Oregon Ducks had a 10-point lead with 8 minutes, 20 seconds remaining in regulation against Washington State on Saturday, but couldn't hold off the Cougars, who scored to force overtime and eventually won, 45-38 in double-overtime at Autzen Stadium.
Oregon Ducks coach Mark Helfrich talked after the game about frustration.
"That's very frustrating when you're extremely close to finishing it out," Helfrich said. "And that's when you need to finish it."
But the Ducks didn't. Helfrich talked about using both Jeff Lockie and Taylor Alie at quarterback, about using Charles Nelson primarily on defense and about the game clock at the end of regulation.
Check out his post-game press conference.
